channel.title: Lime Job Postings
channel.description: Job postings for Lime from lever.co

item.title: Warehouse Lead, Rome
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
Lime is looking for a motivated, ambitious and experienced Warehouse Lead to manage the day-to-day activities of a team of specialized mechanics, technicians (e.g. battery management, safety, and spare parts) as well as other warehouse workers to ensure effective repairs in line with Lime global standards and procedures and in accordance to local compliance and safety rules.

item.title: Staff Software Engineer, Payments & Fraud (Remote)
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
We are looking for a staff software engineer to join our fast-growing team and lead two critical areas at Lime: payments and fraud
On the payments side, Lime’s global presence makes payments a big challenge to tackle - our riders transact in more than 20 countries across multiple payment methods on five continents. This team focuses on building Lime’s Payments platform, driving down transaction costs, improving authorization rates, and expanding local payments integrations.
On the fraud side, Lime’s micromobility platform relies on the trust of our consumers. That's why we are always on the lookout for fraud among users trying to misuse our systems, which affects the community at large. This team is building a real-time risk engine that leverages heuristic rules and machine learning to evaluate every transaction, provides the foundational infrastructure for us to make accurate decisions in real-time, and ultimately drives a strong bottom line for Lime.

item.title: Staff Researcher (Remote)
item.description:

Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
We are seeking an experienced Staff Researcher to lead research initiatives across our rider, operator, and city product experiences. You will play an influential role in shaping the future of our products, service, and company. Your experience with qualitative and quantitative research methods and strong communication and collaboration skills will influence the most important software and hardware product decisions. You will join a team of fun, passionate, and talented folks from around the world who are driven to make our cities more livable, more breathable, and more enjoyable.

item.title: Staff Product Designer, Rider (Remote)
item.description:

Learn more at li.me!
We are seeking an experienced Staff Product Designer to lead design initiatives for our consumer-facing products and establish design patterns to enhance our global rider experience. Your work will be seen and used by consumers all over the world in the 150+ markets we operate in.
In addition to solid interaction and visual design skills, candidates should have experience thinking in terms of end-to-end user journey, applying strategic thinking and business goals to designs, and focusing on user feedback. We also look for candidates who know how to work as a team since you’ll be working with product managers, product designers, and engineers.

item.title: Staff Data Scientist, Machine Learning (Remote)
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
Data is at the core of every decision at Lime - from designing vehicles, to deploying them, enhancing the user’s experience, optimizing our supply chain or warehouse operations. Every team at Lime engages with Data Science & Analytics. Our goal is to provide data insights and models that drive better business outcomes.
We are looking for intellectually curious, highly motivated individuals to join our Data Science & Analytics team. You will partner with our Engineering, Product, and Operations teams to identify critical issues to the business, develop a deep understanding of them, and design scalable solutions. You will leverage your quantitative and modeling skills to transform signals into insights, and insights into actions. You should have strong ML or optimization modeling skills, analytical insights, excellent communication abilities, and a knack for working across teams in a fast-paced environment.

You will be an integral part of building new processes and mechanisms as well as driving experimentation, precision in execution and efficiency through data-based decisions and analytical problem-solving.
Veterans warmly welcome and encouraged to apply

Here at Lime, our goal is to be deeply integrated into the fabric of cities all over the world. This means, as a software engineer on the City Success team, you’ll work on exciting challenges and difficult problems such as Parking and Safety, to help cities effectively integrate micromobility products into their communities.
The right candidate will display an eagerness to solve consumer-facing problems, a passion for working cross-functionally with Product, Design, Data, and Government Relationships, and an ability to drive vague and complex problems to a resolution.

item.title: Senior Manager, Safety Policy (Remote)
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
Safety is at the core of everything we do at Lime. The Senior Manager of Safety Policy is a highly strategic position, entrusted with crafting Lime’s safety policy strategy, and articulating our policy goals and positions both internally and externally. You will work with Government Relations teams around the world to adapt our global positions to local markets, empowering local teams to address safety-related regulatory challenges. You will guide the creation of policy safety campaigns and external-facing facing materials (such as white papers and safety reports) that elevate Lime as the industry leader on safety, in partnership with Brand & Communications, Trust & Safety, and Policy Research. In parallel, you will establish strategic partnerships with global safety organizations to amplify and validate Lime’s positions. In this position, you will report to the Global Head of Policy.

We are a fast-growing company looking for a Paralegal to provide support to our Legal Director for the Americas and APAC (AAA). In this role, you will support the legal functions to operate effectively including managing the team's administrative tasks including a budget, time reporting, project management & tracking, as well as handling some legal research tasks including commercial contract summaries, legal research, and other matters with the AAA and the wider Americas and APAC business.
The ideal candidate for this position has a proactive mindset with the ability to successfully manage multiple priorities, work with individuals at all levels, approach assignments in unknown areas, and has the aptitude to maintain a high level of confidentiality while utilizing great judgment and discretion.
The successful candidate can be located remotely in Poland. This is a fully remote position with no requirements to enter the office or warehouse. This is a US-support role where you will be required to work the evening shift (2:00 pm-10:00 pm CEST) and might need to travel on an infrequent basis.

Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. What You’ll Do Be responsible for the maintenance of vehicles in Lime Warehouse Perform all the type of repairs from a screw tightening to the most complicated electronic part replacement Follow processes. Able to comply with and to enforce processes Follow established safety procedures and techniques to perform job duties and make sure Lime riders are on the safest vehicles Maximize the number of operational vehicles in the fleet Problem solve. What We Offer Opportunity to help build a startup Play a role in the transformation of urban mobility and sustainability Work with a team of fun and motivated individuals Flexible hours - part-time or full time. Help us fill in our coverage schedule!

item.description:

What You’ll Do Be responsible for the maintenance of e-scooters in Lime Warehouse Perform all the type of repairs from a screw tightening to the most complicated electronic part replacement Maximize the number of operational vehicles in the fleet Assist with scooter deployment and retrieval Operate a van to redistribute products as required Follow established safety procedures and techniques to perform job duties and make sure Lime riders are on the safest vehicles Problem solve. SCOP plays a critical role in enabling all of Lime’s global markets to achieve their operational goals by using data to plan asset purchase and facilitate resource allocation decisions, frequently interacting with operations and functional leaders across Lime.

item.title: Business Information Systems : Enterprise Architect (Remote)
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
Lime is hiring an Enterprise Architect, Business Information Systems (BIS), to join our team within the Finance organization. In this role, you will work to improve Lime’s BIS efficiency and organizational structure by building or improving the IT infrastructure. This includes creating and implementing clear strategy and direction on how to integrate business’ current information programs and applications to increase productivity and structure in the workplace. Some of the applications to integrate include NetSuite, Coupa, Workday, Oracle Financial Hub, Anaplan and other similar SaaS applications. You will be responsible for driving the strategy on how these applications and other boundary systems are designed and used, while collaborating with the Senior Leadership team at Lime and our implementation partners.
In addition, you will also be responsible for design, coordinate and manage the organization’s architecture models to help it perform more effectively and enhance the technology processes. You will also build the core-competency by evaluating the systems engineering and talent recruiting processes for the BIS organization to spot any vulnerabilities or discrepancies in our systems. Along with managing a team that supports you on these strategic initiatives.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer (Fulfillment Team) (Remote)
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
As a backend Software Engineer at Lime, you'll build the core technology that powers Lime's global services. You’ll craft systems that serve boatloads of requests from our connected vehicles and consumer-facing apps. On a typical day, you’ll be working alongside a group of engineers, designers, and PMs with experience from top companies.
The Fulfillment team builds the state-of-the-art algorithm that delivers the vehicles to the right place at the right time based on our demand. Imagine how you can help optimize the traveling salesman’s problem in real life? Your work will profoundly impact customer’s satisfaction, Lime’s gross revenue, and long term success of the business.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer
item.description:
Lime is the world's largest shared electric vehicle company. We are on a mission to build a future of transportation that is shared, affordable and carbon-free. Named a Time 100 Most Influential Company in 2021, Lime has powered more than 350 million electric bike and scooter rides in more than 200 cities across five continents, saving an estimated 75+ million car trips. Learn more at li.me!
Lime is looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Backend to join our Engineering team and help us to revolutionize the micro-mobility space! As a backend Software Engineer at Lime, you will build the core technology that powers Lime's global services. You will also craft systems that serve boatloads of requests from our connected vehicles and consumer-facing apps. On a typical day, you will work alongside a group of engineers, designers, and PMs with experience from top companies.
We are a remote first organization and are accepting applications across the United State and Canada for this position.

Learn more at li.me!
We are looking for a strong senior engineer on the Rider team to participate in getting our Rider Experiences and Growth to the next level.
The Rider team is the heart of Lime’s business. We are responsible for serving all of Lime’s riders from signup, taking trips, pricing, loyalty, until they become power users.
You’ll work on big bets as well as scaling successful products. You’ll re-architect large scale projects to revamp the rider experiences. The best part? You’ll be able to showcase what you built with your own hands to your friends and family in real life.
